result.execSummary:
The defendant Bethany R Parker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 50% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment /Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.

Eligible for programs Challenge and Substance, after 6 months.
No Contact with William Parker, unless approved in advance by the Agent.
Continue to comply with the Methadone treatment, any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Comply with Portage County Health and Human Services/CHIPs requirements as it pertains to son.
Sign authorizations or release of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treament and to monitor her methadone treatments.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Pay all financial obligations at least prior to 90 days of discharge.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.
Bond on file to be applied.
AODA assessment if one has not done in the last 12 months & comply with treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Comply with same conditions as Count 1.

records.addlTxt:
2:20 p.m. Defendant Bethany R Parker in court with attorney robert a gardner. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received the PSI report. Court allow a recess to allow Defense to review a PSI addemum that was received by the Court today.
2:43 p.m. Court back in session. Atty Gardner makes minor corrections to the PSI report.
State makes argument for a prison sentencing recommendation.
Atty Gardner makes argument for a probation sentencing recommendation. 5 days credit. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:**PROBATION****
15CF449 Count 1: 
I/S Sentence: 30 mo Incarceration & 36 mo Extended Supervision, 5 days Credit - Stayed
Eligible for programs Challenge and Substance
30 mo Probation
Conditions:
No Contact with William Parker, unless approved in advance by the Agent.
AODA assessment if one has not done in the last 12 months & comply with treatment recommendations.
Continue to comply with the Methadone treatment, any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment/Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.
Comply with Portage County Health and Human Services/CHIPs requirements as it pertains to son.
Sign authorizations or release of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and/or treament and to monitor her methadone treatments.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Pay all financial obligations at least prior to 90 days of discharge.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.
Pay cost and DNA surcharges.
Bond on file to be applied.

15CF449 Count 2: W/H SEntence.
12 mo Probation, concurrent with Count 1.
Comply with same conditions as count 1.
Pay costs.
Sentencing hearing on December 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
(sent to ADA CC/Atty Gardner 10-27/kp)
original filed in 15CF449
Sentencing hearing on November 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Bethany R Parker in court with attorney Robert A. Gardner. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF449 & 16CF64.

9:17 a.m.   Court calls case and states appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Gardner takes a moment to discuss the plea with Atty Cousins.
Atty Cousins makes clarification of the plea recommendations on the record.
9:21 a.m.  Atty Gardner requests a brief recess to answer questions from his client. 
9:32 a.m.  Court is back in session and appearances remain the same.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Gardner would request that the forfeiture of the vehicle in case #15CV364 be stayed until the sentencing hearing.
9:38 a.m.  Atty Gardner interrupts and states that the plea agreement would be incomplete and states these issues on the record.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF449:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - Guilty

16CF64:
Count 1 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2 of 15CF449 and Count 1 of 16CF64 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BY THE COURT:
Vehicle forfeiture action in 15CV364, as commenced, to be stayed pending sentencing on this case.
PSI ordered and to be provided to the parties no later than one week prior to sentencing.
Bond is continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 11:00 am.
